RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 12700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MARCH 7, 2023. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wher e Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SUPER WILDCAT raced with the pace through the backstretch, inched clear midway on the turn and was kept sharp to hold on well. MAKE IT A DOUBLE chased outside, raced in the five path on the turn and dueled for second mid-stretch. SCARLET TANAGER chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. LOST ANCHOR raced with the pace inside and entered the turn at even terms, but dropped back midway through the turn and flattened in the lane. MOJO MATTERS chased and raced off the rail on the turn, eased out entering the stretch and passed rivals outside. NANCYSAIDSO chased, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. GRAM'S GAL chased the leaders through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Nancysaidso
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

ENTRY.NAME: Lost Anchor
ENTRY.COMMENT: w/pace inside,even terms into turn,dropped back 3/16,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Mojo Matters
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,passed rivals outside

ENTRY.NAME: Super Wildcat
ENTRY.COMMENT: w/pace 2d,inched clear mid turn,kept sharp lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 76. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DOC ELM gave chase inside, raced near the rail on the turn, eased out leaving the turn, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch and held on well with steady handling. FROGGY THE GREMLIN chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path and finished well to clear second later yards. THUNDERINREADYRICK was shuffled back at the start then gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the six path and came along to take third the final yards. GUN FACTOR chased inside and took over past the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn but flattened stride inside the eighth pole. ABENDEGO chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn, entered the stretch outside and showed little further. BIGZ'S CABANA BOY came away awkwardly and took a brief early lead, was met past the three eighths pole, rounded the turn in the five path then weakened. FIFTY FIFTY gave chase then weakened two deep on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Doc Elm
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,eased out 1/8,up near 1/16,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Froggy the Gremlin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,6p turn,cleared 2nd later yards,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back start,chased,6p turn,along 3rd final yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 18600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MR CHANCE ROMANCE took the lead soon after the start and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, was met approaching the quarter and contested the edge nearest the rail on the far turn then dug in determinedly and just lasted. NEVERPOPTHECORK rounded the opening turn in the two and three paths, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the four path the far turn, dug in through the stretch for second and just missed. CHASE LIL ME saved ground well off the early pace, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and raced in the six path on the far turn, then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. ROAD SLEW saved ground, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and finished well inside. ORANGEBURG stalked two deep then challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, dueled to even terms toward the quarter, contested at a close disadvantage through the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. NO LOVE FOR JUBA bobbled at the break and rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. MODERN DAY ROMANCE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and weakened. GET OFF MY CLOUD settled inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Slew
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,chased 7/16,2d far turn,finished well inside

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Maiden Claiming Purse 10800. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SURF CITY GOLD settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and steadily improved, raced off the rail on the far turn, dug in for the lead between horses later yards and kept the nod under the wire. ROYAL AIR FORCE was shuffled back at the start, raced in the four path the first turn and steadily improved from the half mile pole and took the lead past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path, drifted a bit into the lane, dug in gamely though, missed the nod. TAKE AIM rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole and contested even terms at the rail into the far turn, dug in with the advantage leaving the turn but was met later yards and flattened toward the wire. MIMS SECOND CHANCE was hustled with the early pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Buff's Cat leaving the half mile pole, gave chase from the three eighths, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the lane. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME was shuffled back at the start then saved ground, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and flattened in the stretch. FLASH OF DAY came away awkwardly and steadied approaching the first turn then rated close on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn. SMOKIN SMITTY showed little response through the backstretch. BUFF'S CAT stalked two deep, moved to even terms into the backstretch and gave chase, then faded past the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Surf City Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Gardner Sean and MIH Affiliates LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,up between late,kept nod wire

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Dr. & Mrs. Thomas Bowman, Rick Buckley& Joshua Dreiband

ENTRY.NAME: Take Aim
ENTRY.OWNER: Jones Jr Michael E and JKX Racing

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Air Force
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled start,4p 1st turn,up past 3/8,3p far turn,game,missd nod

ENTRY.NAME: Flash of Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,steadied early,rated close,weakened far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 7 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KNOBIESMAGICSONDE chased from the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the turn then dug in through the last eighth to get up the final strides. IT'S A REAL HONOR was hustled along and took the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole then rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, dug in under steady stretch handling but was caught in the final strides. JUJU ON DA BEAT gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and took the nod for third under the wire. PATTI BLUE EYES veered out and exchanged contact with. LET'S DO THIS leaving the gate then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn, raced evenly in the lane and was nipped from third at the wire. The latter exchanged contact with Patti Blue Eyes leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. GOLDEN SALLY chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened in the lane. SHOWTHEMONEYHONEY was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: It's a Real Honor
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to lead,rated pace,pressured 5/16,rail turn,caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close off rail turn,dug in lane,up final strides

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: James W. Shawyer & Mary Butts Shawyer

ENTRY.NAME: Patti Blue Eyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Fanelli John Cash is King LLC and LC Racing LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 7 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KEEP ON SPURRIN chased through the backstretch and raced close two deep on the turn, dug in to take the lead later yards and held on. DIXIE YODELER chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, improved through traffic in the stretch, angled in later yards and just missed. CRAFTY WINDSOR CAT took the lead past the half mile pole and rated the pace, raced near the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch handling but was met late and flattened nearing the wire. DREAMY SONDE was unprepared for the break then gave chase inside, raced near the rail on the turn, was shut off at the inside flank of Dixie Yodeler late yards and flattened stride. SILVER RULES chased through the backstretch,raced in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. COWGIRL ATTITUDE chased and raced close three wide on the turn then flattened stride. CHEROKEE CASTLE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn four wide then weakened widest.

ENTRY.NAME: Crafty Windsor Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,rail turn,dug in lane,met later yards,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Keep On Spurrin
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,close 2d turn,dug in lane,up later yards,held on

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Yodeler
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,through traffic lane,angled in late,just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Dreamy Sonde
ENTRY.OWNER: Pascal Lawrence J and Harding Sr Philip Arthur

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 27400. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since July 7 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRYDA accelerated to the lead approaching the seven sixteenths pole and set a pressured pace, edged clear toward the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was kept alert to hold on well. BELLA MELA exchanged contact with Timetogetup and was forced inward and into Asue leaving the gate, gave chase into the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, finished well to take second in the final yards and was gaining on the winner. FANCY HER UP had a brief early lead then gave chase, dropped back toward the quarter pole, rounded the turn off the rail then flattened inside the eighth pole. SENTELLA ducked outward and made contact with Asue leaving the gate then gave chase, rounded the turn about the four path and finished evenly outside. WHALE OF A TIME was reluctant to load then chased outside, raced in the five and six paths on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ASUE was bumped outward and into Bella Mela leaving the gate then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. TIMETOGETUP ducked in and made contact with Bella Mela leaving the gate then gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. EMBERLY chased, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. MAP THE MOMENT broke a step slow and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Stryda
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 7/16,set pressured pace,clear near 1/4,rail,held well

ENTRY.NAME: Bella Mela
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased,off rail turn,finished well,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Whale of a Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load,chased outside,5& 6p turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 48. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WINDSOR'S STAR took the lead approaching the half mile pole and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and held on under steady handling. KING OF LUCK exchanged contact with To The Top leaving the gate then gave chase, was kept in check behind a narrowing opening at the rail nearing the five sixteenths pole, recovered stride and raced at the rail through the turn, eased out toward the head of the lane and dug in to take second inside the sixteenth pole. METALLIC CAT exchanged contact with Chartered Course leaving the gate then gave chase, raced close in the three path on the turn but was outfinished for second the final sixteenth. RAISE A RUCKUS chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail then flattened approaching the sixteenth pole. GETTIN SPICY gave chase then faded into the turn. TO THE TOP was not a factor. CHARTERED COURSE exchanged contact with Metallic Cat leaving the gate then gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE gave chase through the backstretch then faded into the turn. SENZA STRIKE saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: King of Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chase,kept in check near 5/16,rail turn,up 2nd 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 1/2,rated pace,pressured 3/8,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Metallic Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Chartered Course
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,chased outside,5p turn,little in lane
